com.okta.scim.util.model
Class SCIMResource

java.lang.Object
  com.okta.scim.util.model.SCIMResource
Direct Known Subclasses:
SCIMGroup, SCIMUser
public class SCIMResource
extends java.lang.Object

This class holds the following attributes:

  • Custom SCIM attributes of a resource - custom properties map

All the standard attributes can be accessed using the getters and setters of the Resource object. The custom properties can be accessed in the following two ways:

  1. Directly accessing the JsonNode associated with a custom schema name.
  2. Getters and setters for the custom properties.

getCustomStringValue

public java.lang.String getCustomStringValue(java.lang.String schemaName,
                                             java.lang.String fieldName,
                                             java.lang.String... parentNames)
                                      throws InvalidDataTypeException
Get a custom string value.

The parent names should be in order. For example, to get the value of property d in {"urn1":{"b":{"c":{"d":"e"}}}}, execute getCustomStringValue("urn1", "d", "b","c").

Parameters:
schemaName - the URN of the custom schema.
fieldName - the field name corresponding to the custom value.
parentNames - the names of the parent fields.
Throws:
InvalidDataTypeException

The parent names should be in order. For example, to get the value of property d in {"urn1":{"b":{"c":{"d":1}}}}, execute getCustomIntValue("urn1", "d", "b","c").

Parameters:

                                                            java.lang.String fieldName,
                                                            java.lang.String... parentNames)
                                                     throws InvalidDataTypeException
Get a custom string list.

The parent names should be in order. For example, to get the value of property d in {"urn1":{"b":{"c":{"d":["e","f]}}}}, execute getCustomStringList("urn1", "d", "b","c").

Parameters:
schemaName - the URN of the custom schema.
fieldName - the field name corresponding to the custom value.

                                      throws InvalidDataTypeException
Get a custom double value.

The parent names should be in order. For example, to get the value of property d in {"urn1":{"b":{"c":{"d":3.1415}}}}, execute getCustomDouble("urn1", "d", "b","c").

Parameters:

setCustomStringValue

public void setCustomStringValue(java.lang.String schemaName,
                                 java.lang.String fieldName,
                                 java.lang.String value,
                                 java.lang.String... parentNames)
Set a custom string value.

The parent names should be in order. For example, to get the value of property d to e in a json-like {"urn1":{"b":{"c":{"d":"e"}}}}, execute setCustomStringValue("urn1", "d", "e", "b","c").

Parameters:
schemaName - the URN of the custom schema.
fieldName - the field name corresponding to the custom value.
value - the value to be set.
parentNames - the names of the parent fields.

setCustomIntValue

public void setCustomIntValue(java.lang.String schemaName,
                              java.lang.String fieldName,
                              java.lang.Integer value,
                              java.lang.String... parentNames)
Set a custom integer value.

The parent names should be in order. For example, to set the value of property d to 1 to result in a json-like {"urn1":{"b":{"c":{"d":1}}}}, execute setCustomIntValue("urn1", "d", 1, "b","c").

Parameters:
schemaName - the URN of the custom schema.
fieldName - the field name corresponding to the custom value.
value - the value to be set.
parentNames - the names of the parent fields.

setCustomBooleanValue

public void setCustomBooleanValue(java.lang.String schemaName,
                                  java.lang.String fieldName,
                                  java.lang.Boolean value,
                                  java.lang.String... parentNames)
Set a custom Boolean value.

The parent names should be in order. For example, to set the value of property d to false to result in a json-like {"urn1":{"b":{"c":{"d":false}}}}, execute setCustomBooleanValue("urn1", "d", false, "b","c").

Parameters:
schemaName - the URN of the custom schema.
fieldName - the field name corresponding to the custom value.
value - the value to be set.
parentNames - the names of the parent fields.

setCustomStringList

public void setCustomStringList(java.lang.String schemaName,
                                java.lang.String fieldName,
                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> value,
                                java.lang.String... parentNames)
Set a custom string list.

The parent names should be in order. For example, to set the value of property d to ["f","g"] to result in a json-like {"urn1":{"b":{"c":{"d":"e"}}}}, execute setCustomStringValue("urn1", "d", stringList, "b","c"), where stringList is a list containing the values.

Parameters:
schemaName - the URN of the custom schema.
fieldName - the field name corresponding to the custom value.
value - the value to be set.
parentNames - the names of the parent fields.

The parent names should be in order. For example, to set the value of property d to ["f","g"] to result in a json-like {"urn1":{"b":{"c":{"d":3.1415}}}}, execute setCustomDoubleValue("urn1", "d", 3.1415, "b","c").

Parameters:
schemaName - the URN of the custom schema.
fieldName - the field name corresponding to the custom value.
value - the value to be set.
parentNames - the names of the parent fields.
